page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES
page.content: Principal features.Risca is situated on the southern edge of the south wales coalfield where the ebbw valley opens out onto the coastal plain.This valley is known as the"Western valley" because it is the most westerly valley in Gwent.Overlooking the town on either side are two large hills called Mynydd Machen and Mynydd Henllys.On top of Mynydd Henllys at 419m is an ancient fortress called the"Tump".The town takes up the valley floor but as you move up the hillsides the houses give way to hill farms and forests.Risca has a small reservoir called pant-yr-eos which means hollow of the nigntingale.An old disused canal called the Monmouthshire and Brecon canal runs through the town.It also has a goods railway and a new road to by-pass the town is under construction.
